sn35.7:3.1: 7 The Interior as Impermanent in the Three Times
sn35.7:4.1: “Mendicants, the eye of the past and future is impermanent,
sn35.7:4.3: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the eye of the past,
sn35.7:4.4: they don’t look forward to enjoying the eye in the future,
sn35.7:4.5: and they practice for the disillusionment, fading away, and cessation of the eye in the present.
sn35.7:4.14: mind of the past and future is impermanent,
sn35.7:4.16: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the mind of the  past,
sn35.7:4.17: they don’t look forward to enjoying the mind in the future,
sn35.7:4.18: and they practice for the disillusionment, fading away, and cessation of the mind in the present.”
